comment.text: I've had the buffalo chick substitute and it's deeeeeelicious. Great vegan menu. If you try this place you'll definitely love it.
I'm not vegan or vegetarian but this place is really good! Took my vegetarian daughter there twice now and both times it was delicious!

I went to Cafe Sunflower Buckhead on 7/20 for my sister's birthday. We were seated fairly quickly because we made reservations. I've been before and was excited to go again. We were going to order some cocktails but they only have beer and wine as an option for alcoholic beverages. Also, with it being 5 people at the table, the waitress was very friendly and answered all of our questions. 

I think Cafe Sunflower Buckhead is a great restaurant but for the food items they serve, I think it is over priced. We had four shared appetizers (spinach and artichoke dip, spring rolls, Buffalo lollipops, and the avocado tacos. I ordered the sesame chicken soy and it was $19.00. The portion was average but because of all the appetizers that were ordered, I took some of my entree to go. It did not warm up well and I was very disappointed! 

I really enjoy going to cafe sunflower but those prices! There's no reason why spaghetti bolognese (didn't order) should be almost $30.00 or even a plant based burger for $18.00.

The food here was really enjoyable. We came for lunch and I was a bit skeptical but my girl who brought me here said the food was really good. 

We had the Dumplings, the avocado tacos to start- Both were really really good.

I wanted to get the Kale salad option but our waiter let us know the special for the day was a Paella dish. Say NO more, we both went for the Paella and it was super. All the veggies were well seasoned and balanced out.

So good. I am not Vegan but I like to eat plant based as much as I can. Let me say I went to eat at a normal restaurant later that day, and Seafood paella was ordered by the table, well this Vegan paella was better than that one, if you can imagine.

I absolutely loved this ALL vegan restaurant! I went for lunch with a friend. The host sat us right away and the waiter came immediately to take our drink order. His name was Louis. Very nice and informative about the menu. The food came so quick. I ordered the nachos for an appetizer which were pretty tasty. The only thing is... I would've loved to have some sour cream and a little salt. But it was very fresh and I'd get it again for sure! 
For the main course, I ordered the bolognese which was also pretty yummy. For dessert, I got the chocolate peanut butter mousse cake which was AMAZING!!! My husband recently became vegan and I'll definitely take him. I know he'd love it. I recommend this restaurant for sure!!! I'll be back.

photos.caption: Vegan Chocolate peanut butter mousse cake

comment.text:
I had such high expectations for this place but it was very average.  The service was fine, the atmosphere was nice, but the food was sub par. 

Crab cakes: too salty, bland rice, tacky plate design 
Burger: pretty good, 'healthy' tasting bc there wasn't much seasoning to it lol 
Fried avocado tacos: good but who makes only 3?? It's either you make 2 or 4. We had to share the last one, but imagine if I wasn't in the mood to share. Then what. 

Anyways, try it if you wanna feel like you're being healthy but steer clear if you want a decent priced, good meal.

This is my friends' favorite vegan joint, and I can definitely see why! They have a fairly wide variety of foods with plenty of options for all sorts of picky eaters (gluten free for me). 

I got their "burrito," which were more like tacos as gluten free (corn tortillas on the side). I absolutely loved the dish--who can say no to avocado, well seasoned mushroom-quinoa, and steamed spinach? The sweet potato mash was good too, but it weirded me out going in a burrito/taco (I'm from LA)...it's good on it's own though. Chipotle aioli was also delicious! Their corn tortillas were surprisingly very good--full corn flavor, which I surprisingly usually don't get a lot of from other places that serve corn tortillas.

Pad thai: I loved the texture of their noodles! Just the right amount of chewy, but still soft enough to bite through--this is definitely a good dish to get. I won't say that this is "pad thai" as much as they're "asian-style noodles covered with peanut -based sauce," (once again, I'm from LA) but it was VERY delicious and filling. I'd say this was my favorite dish of everything we ordered.

Spinach artichoke dip: The corn tortillas I raved about before, but in chips form and dunked in a delicious "I can't believe it's vegan" creamy sauce! This is a wonderful gluten free appetizer for everyone to share!

My friends also got the chicken lollis, which weren't gluten free, but they get it every single time. I'll assume that this is some amazing stuff, so I'd encourage y'all to try it if you can eat gluten.

Overall, this is a very solid vegan restaurant, and I would love to come again to check out their desserts and other entrees. If you live in the area and love your veggies, you will definitely love this place as well!

NICE VEGAN SPOT!!! Has indoor and outdoor seating. Inside has a warm ambiance. Nice wine selection. I came here to reunite with my vegan friend so I had to find a spot that she would feel comfortable eating at. This place was perfect. I had the fried avocado tacos. Im not a vegan person but I love avocados so that was a plus. I also had the vegan orange chicken and egg rolls. Thumbs up on all the food! Im shocked at how tasty it all was!

Café Sunflower Buckhead
When another restaurant was closed due to the Wuhan virus, I walked in, and ordered what I thought was an overpriced chicken caesar at $13, figuring it's good to support a local business during this crisis. Boy, was this a mistake! The salad had almost no "chicken" and the small container of out-of-the-jar "dressing" was on the side, not tossed in as a proper caesar salad should be. When I asked for a couple more containers, the owner brought out one.

The only reason for the second star was that they had hand sanitizer on the host stand.

It's been a while since I've had a chance to visit Cafe Sunflower. My first time here was at its original location, and I was not impressed. It was my vegetarian coworker's birthday, so we decided to trek it out for a great meal for her. Little did I know the transformation here would be so tremendous. 

The restaurant is sunlit, chic and modern, a far cry from the dim and murky hippie vibe of the previous location. Our server was friendly and sincere as he took our orders. I had the Pad Thai - which was delicious - and a cup of Butternut Squash soup, whiit was pretty good but nothing mind blowing. The Pad Thai was very filling with the noodles and tofu, but smelled very strongly of something fried or super nutty, not sure what exactly it was. It was tasty but after a while, the strong flavors definitely got a hold of me. I took about 40% of it to go. 

Overall, I was pleasantly surprised. I've got to come back and try some of the other items on the menu that I had been trying to decide between.

photos.caption: First page of the lunch menu

comment.text: I went here on evening with my non-vegan boyfriend. He has the shrimp tacos which were sooo tasty and the largest taco portion I've ever seen. We also got spring rolls and wings as starters, delicious! I got the eggplant lasagna as my entree which was yummy and super healthy packed with tons of vegetables and tofu. It's always refreshing to go to a vegan restaurant that doesn't offer different types of processed meats and burgers... the ambiance was also nice and dark. Perfect for an initiate date night :) whenever I am in the area again I will return!

This was my first visit to a vegan restaurant. I was pessimistic, but it turned out good. The GPS did have a hard a hard time finding it. The atmosphere is casual. The staff were friendly. The menu was varied and not my normal choices. I decided to stay in my comfort zone. 
The springs rolls were small but tasty. I had the pad Thai for the entree. The noodles were large and flat, lots of mushrooms, zucchini and green beans. The sauce was good and rich. I did not like the tofu (it's a texture thing). But the pieces were large enough to remove. Everyone else's food looked good, but not my thing. Desert was delicious. 
I have to say I was pleasantly surprised, but I did play it safe. My system was a little off later that night and the next morning. So first timers be aware.

I stumbled across Cafe Sunflower randomly last night after my original dinner plans fell through. I was definitely impressed with the ambiance of the restaurant it was nicely decorated with low lighting to give a nice upscale dining feel. I ordered the spring rolls for an appetizer they were okay & definitely not the best I have had. For the main course I had the sesame soy chicken & my bf had the pad thai. Overall we both enjoyed our dishes & would return. Hopefully on the next visit service will be better after the host seated us it took our server about 10 minutes to come over & greet us/take our drink orders. The food also took a very long time to come to our table.

photos.caption: Front sesame soy chicken Back spicy pad thai

comment.text:
As recently transition vegans my husband and I are on the hunt for vegan restaurants in Atlanta.  On Sunday we went to Cafe Sunflower for brunch.  The restaurant serves Sunday brunch until 2p. We arrived at 1:20p. The hostess informed us that as a precaution due to the line and the kitchen closing at 1:50, there was a possibly we may not get a chance to dine in.  Luckily, we waited and 10 minutes later were seated.  Due to kitchen closing soon promptly after being seated we ordered.  I had the loaded breakfast with a mimosa, and my husband had the avocado toast.  We both enjoyed our meals , and even as "baby vegans," we didn't miss meat one bit.  I definitely recommend this place to vegans and carnivores as the meals are flavorful and well prepared.

S/N:  the restaurant recently transitioned to 100% vegan this year.  I guess perhaps they once has non vegan options.

photos.caption: Loaded breakfast burrito part 2.... so good and filling

comment.text:
Best plant friendly establishment I have been to. For a while I was plant based and came here. I am no longer plant based and STILL come here. Please try the Buffalo Lollipops they taste JUST like the real thing sometimes I even think they're better than the real thing. Don't skip
out on the "blue cheese" sauce as well it pair perfectly with the buffalo pops. The shrimp tacos are great here I was so shocked at how similar of a texture to shrimp they had. If you are not into meat alternatives they also have a great list of options like the Orzo Eggplant Lasagna. Don't be turned off by this vegan place it's just as great as any other meat serving establishment!

I'm now thinking about becoming a vegetarian after my visit to Cafe Sunflower. Everything is vegetarian and many of the menu items are vegan. This is the first vegetarian restaurant in Atlanta that I have dined at that truly makes you question why you even bother eating meat of any kind.

The customer service was great. We were seated fairly quickly. The ambiance was chic with dim lighting perfect for a date or a night out with friends. Our waitress gave my skeptical meat eating dining partners great suggestions which had them huge fans of not only Cafe Sunflower but also vegatarian food by the time we were done. 

Everything we tried was very flavorful. We had the crispy Brussel Sprouts as an appetizer, they had a sweet tangy glaze over top of fried Brussel Sprouts and were delicious. The portions were all a good size. I ordered the Sesame Chicken which was to die for. Every bite of my dish tasted like a party was happening right inside my mouth. All of the flavors went together perfectly and the soy chicken was firm it had my dinner partners questioning if it was actually really soy. Someone else at my table had the Eggplant  Lasagna and said it was very good. I tried the Lasagna and the asparagus which was placed on top was cooked perfectly. The rest of the dish had an abundance of flavors that did not do much for me but the person who ordered the dish said he loved it. Cafe Sunflower was a pleasant surprise.
This place has great food for vegans and vegetarians. A great atmosphere as well and very welcoming. If you are just starting to try vegetarian dining this is a great restaurant to try.

I'm not a vegan or vegetarian but I absolutely love the brunch here. I was weary the first time I came with my newly vegetarian friend because the menu didn't have anything I thought I would like. Well needless to say I was wrong. On my first visit I got the burrito and was blown away. So filling and tasty. On my second visit I got the pancakes and again my mouth had a party. The best fake butter I've ever had. Now today I came solo because I was fasting and needed something to eat that would fill me up and not put my body into shock.

I'm here a few minutes before they open and a small line has formed. I still see a few others waiting in their cars. Today I'm going to go for the German Chocolate cake.

owner_replies.comment:
It's wonderful you enjoyed the burrito and pancakes, Sharese! We're so glad you and your friend have loved everything. It's been a pleasure seeing you here! We hope the German chocolate cake hit the spot :) 

All the best,
Annie, General Manager

comment.text: Passed by this place plenty of times in Buckhead. Decided to finally come for brunch a few weekends ago. Wow! Very impressed! Settled for blueberry pancakes and tofu scamble. Belly full and happy. A line appeared before it opened up for the day. Worth the wait.

The food was great. The customer service was exceptional. Overall, amazing. 

Be sure to try: 

Spring Rolls
Sesame Soy Chicken

Why does this place have such a high rating? ‍ My first, only and last visit to Cafe Sunflower. So disappointed at the lack of flavor in their food. The shrimp tacos and spinach artichoke dip were lacking in seasoning. These menu items sounded so inviting but they just didn't taste like much. ‍ I don't know...maybe I eat too much ethnic food. I spent over $40, trying to support a vegan business and patron a popular Atlanta restaurant. Ugh!  Between the high prices and bland food, this type of place gives vegan food a bad name (in my opinion). If you're in the Gwinnett area, check out Shawnee's Goodies in Lilburn; affordable and flavorful. I wish I had of taken a photo of the food. It looked great; which was seriously deceiving. Oh and 2 fried vegan shrimp in a taco; 2 tacos for $15+!  Ps. I'm not trying to attack them. I'm being honest just as I am in my previous review. I wish someone had written something similar to this so I could have saved my money. Good luck everyone! #govegan #stayvegan

Ordered the pesto pasta to-go and I was totally impressed! When I peeked inside, I was happy to find extra Covid precautions were being taken, such as plastic guards and social distancing. The food came out super hot and was DELICIOUS! Pesto sauce, pasta, artichokes, capers, spinach, and broccoli with garlic bread. Oh, and did I mention it's all vegan?! The only downside is that it was a little pricey, but if I was ever passing through again, I would definitely stop here!!

Amazing vegan restaurant! We are visiting Atlanta from NYC and are staying in Buckhead so it was an easy drive. It was a Monday night so fairly quiet. Service was excellent and food came quickly. Recommend everything we ordered: avocado tacos appetizer, buffalo wings appetizer, eggplant lasagne main, sesame soy chicken main and red velvet cake dessert (may have over ordered as we were SO full leaving but #noregrets). Overall so glad we came and can't recommend highly enough!

Cafe Sunflower has really great food and great service.

I highly recommend the chicken and biscuits during their brunch hour. The flavor and texture pairings are incredibly delicious.

This is going to a new must-visit restaurant every time I visit!

owner_replies.comment:
We're so glad the food and service has been top notch for you, Annie! It's great the chicken biscuit always hit the spot. We hope you'll be back to see us again sometime soon. 

All the best,
Annie, General Manager

comment.text:
I really enjoyed Cafe Sunflower. My vegan friend picked this place out specifically sighting its great food so I could not wait to give it a try. 

Upon arrival we were pleasantly surprised with a menu that made everybody in the group (even the non veg) happy. They offer entrees with veggie but not vegan options. So if you aren't ready to take the plunge there is still plenty there for you! 

We had a group of 6, and unfortunately I have to say the service was lacking. We were on a lunch break to celebrate a birthday and even asking for the check with the food didn't get us in and out within an 1 1/2 hours. Yikes! Luckily we were cut a break by the business for the birthday and had a minute to enjoy the DELICIOUS chocolate vegan cake for dessert. 

I'd love to come back but I would really have to find some other time where the service is less of a problem. 

A-OK!

owner_replies.comment:
It was a delight having you all join us, Lauren. While we are thrilled you enjoyed the lunch, we apologize the service was not up to par! It can take a while during the lunch rush, but you should expect it to still be prompt. We will have a talk as a team about how to improve on this. Hopefully you'll be back to give us another opportunity to impress you sometime -- we know we can.

All the best,
Annie, General Manager

comment.text: Came by around 1130am for Vegan Sunday Brunch with my girlfriend. We stay visiting from California and wanted to experience the vegan food out in ATL. Very nice welcoming clean setting waiting area. We were seated shortly and luckily our hostess seated us in a booth being we had baggage. Good lookin out! Most of the seating was chairs and tables. Server was very polite and on top of it. I wanted everything on the menu. We decided on Tofu Benedict and Blueberry Pancakes. The Hollandaise sauce made the entree hearty. Super tasty. Shared blueberry pancakes and I have to say this was the best vegan pancakes I have had yet. Great job! Didn't get soggy but had a light crisp which was delightful. Bathroom was very clean easily accessible. If I ever travel to ATL again I will most definitely eat here again. Thank you Cafe Sunflower. The quality speaks through the food. Awesome place.

photos.caption: Tofu Benedict Supposed to get 2  Sharing stay caring!

comment.text: Last weekend I enjoyed delicious appetizers at Cafe Sunflower while celebrating a birthday with friends. We opted for the crispy Brussels sprouts, spring rolls, and spinach & artichoke dip washed down with guava mimosas  For my dinner I had the yellow curry and it would have been great with more spice and seasoning but it was still tasty. Change is hard so I think I will stick with my vegan meatloaf at dinner from now on. Follow me on IG @vegantastesgoodatl

This place was alright. The spinach and artichoke dip was delicious but the main dish need a bit more seasoning. The dessert also wasn't good. I dislike that everything was soy based . Otherwise it was decent.

First time experience-I am neither Vegan, Vegetarian, or Gluten-Free but always open to new cuisine. The atmosphere is beautiful. The restaurant was very clean. Service was great. Our server was always prompt with beverage refills. The food was served hot and large portions. Very filling and flavorful.

owner_replies.comment:
It was a pleasure having you join us, Mary! Thank you so much for the incredible feedback. We're glad you had the chance to try something new and different at our place! We hope you'll be back to see us again sometime soon.

Best,
Annie, General Manager

comment.text: Delicious! I've been a vegan for a few months now (technically I'm bee-fan since I'll eat honey) and was looking for a nice spot to have a healthy lunch with outdoor seating. I found this spot and had a scrumptious set of "shrimp" tacos. The "shrimp" (made with konjac) were a wonderful shrimpy texture and the mango habanero sauce was on point. Service was friendly and prompt - I will totally return and try more of their food!!!

This is the BEST restaurant I have ever been to. It's fully vegan and makes the absolute best food for vegans who want to forget about animal products. I ordered the blueberry pancakes and they were the FLUFFIEST pancakes I have ever eaten. I've been here before and got the cauli steak. It was my first time and I almost didn't wanna eat it bc I thought it was made from animals.
I had the breakfast burrito and omg it was life changing! So yummy and everything else on the menu looked equally good. I would definitely recommend, but keep in mind that it is kinda pricy

Wow...do I love this place.  Everything was so good.  Parking was easy.  Promptly seated.  Not crowded.

Started with the Buffalo Lollipops.  Oh My God.  These are amazeballs.  We also got the mushroom scallops.  They are great too.

Entrees were the home made ravioli and then the chimichuri steak on mashed potatoes with grilled asparagus.  

My only regret is that this restaurant is 100 miles from home.  But I intend on coming again when in Atlanta.  The main problem I see, is wanting to order the things I already know are awesome... and wanting to try new things.

photos.caption: Ravioli.  The sauce. Oh My God the Sauce.....

comment.text:
This was difficult to rate as we came to Cafe Sunflower years ago and had a wonderful experience so we were so excited to come back to Atlanta and have dinner at Cafe Sunflower. 

We had reservations but got there early and they happily seated us. Our server, who was very pleasant, got our drink order (I ordered a flavored tea and my husband a glass of wine). As an appetizer we ordered Spring Rolls, which were pretty tasteless to our surprise. 

Our server gave us some time to enjoy our drinks before we ordered our entrees. I ordered the Cauliflower Steak and my husband the veggie loaf. My Cauliflower was just okay. Outside of the first bite, that was heavily salted, it was pretty tasteless as well. My side of veggies were good, but underwhelming to be honest. 

My husbands loaf, I thought was good, but he felt it was missing seasoning. I did take a bite of his mashed potatoes with I love and we both agreed that we did not care for them. There was a huge after-taste of Almond Milk, which was not pleasant. 

To top our night off, and because we were disappointed in our meals, we decided to have the Peanut Butter Pie, which was delicious. It was worth the extra calories. 

Overall take on our evening. The Cauliflower was not worth the price nor was the loaf. The only item worth the price was the dessert, certainly not the +$100 we spent for our evening. 

Unfortunately, this particular evening ruined our Cafe Sunflower experience. My husband rated the experience a 2 star but I couldn't do that to my vegan friends so it was just okay.
Nice ambiance. Speedy service. Average food. Nicely located in Buckhead. Average pricing for a restaurant. I'll return

Wow.... wow... wow...
This was just among the best vegan food in a very long time! Attentive service, incredible menu, great juices.... wow, really really good, don't know what more to add. Thank you Café Sunflower!!!

photos.caption: Soup of the day: Cauliflower coconut cream... killer
Crab cake... vegan... palm heart base... to die for
Entree dumplings... bulls eye! So good

comment.text:
This is the first exclusively vegan/vegetarian restaurant I've ever been to, and I loved it just as much as I do restaurants that slap meat across my plate. I had the Marsala cauliflower "steak", roasted vegetables, and kale salad. The boyfriend had a risotto that was smooth and buttery -- without butter. 

The best part of the meal was the chocolate cake. That was some of the best chocolate cake I've ever had in my life. Is it entirely vegan? 

Cafe Sunflower gets 4 stars instead of 5 because the waiter could have refilled our water glasses more often, and the prices could be a little bit cheaper for the fact that no meat is used.

WHAT AN AMAZING MEAL! We stopped in thinking it was going to be just a cute quick cafe- it was far more than that. We didn't realize people make reservations here. We were initially told it would be about a 20 minute wait- so we went to order take out. But within a few minutes, a table was available. I tried a few places during my stay in Atlanta and this made my new favorite.  I was so happy to have come for dinner after not having had a meal all day! I ordered the special, sunflower bolognese, my husband the Sesame soy chicken and we ordered the fried avocado tacos as an appetizer. I didn't finish my meal because I got a glimpse of the dessert tray! Perfect meal! Excellent service and friendly customers.

photos.caption: The special Sunflower Bolognese with vegan sausage and garlic bread.

comment.text:
Café Sunflower in Buckhead is located at Brookwood Square next to Houston's Restaurant.  I am not a vegan/vegetarian but I thoroughly enjoyed Café Sunflower.  A good friend of mine visited a group of friends to join her at Café Sunflower since she heard rave reviews.  
 
Our waiter was super nice and very knowledgeable of the menu.  He was able to point out some great food options.  I ordered the spring rolls that consisted of Asian cabbage, carrots, onions, mushrooms, and glass noodles, with a side of sweet and sour sauce. Which was delicious.  I also ordered the Buffalo Lollipops; the homemade buffalo hot sauce was really good, the meat taste kind of taste like ribs.  Overall pretty good, and the closest thing to tasting like real hot wings.

One friend ordered the Spicy Pad Thai Noodles and said it was really good and flavorful.  I did try it and will probably order it during my next visit.  Another friend of mine had the Sesame Soy Chicken (without the soy chicken), he really enjoy and thought it was a good choice for his first vegan meal.  And the friend that invited us also had the Buffalo Lollipop and the Pan Seared Mushroom Scallops and said it was cooked to perfection.  Everything is moderately price and will not break the bank if you decide to go on a random night. 

Overall, we had a great experience with the staff and food service.  We will be back soon.

we ordered the enchiladas and the alfredo. the enchiladas were very good, as someone who is vegetarian and friend who was vegan. the alfredo was a bit tasteless, but still well done. we got the chocolate cake for dinner and it was so good. would never have imagined it was vegan.

came here for lunch. 

service was sloooooow, though there were not that many diners.

had the quinoa and kale bowl. very tasty-- dressing was AMAZING. my kid had the seitan sandwich & gave it the thumbs up. we split the caesar salad, which was small but good

Atlanta, if you love brunch you MUST try Cafe Sunflower's Sunday brunch. The meals were worth the wait and price. Note: they don't take reservations for Sunday brunch. 
I started with a taste of hub's beets and ginger beverage, and from just that taste I know I added like 2 years to my life. That drink tasted like what I imagine is the fountain of youth! 
My eyes popped open, I immediately felt more alert.  

We enjoyed blueberry pancakes with almond butter -- didn't even need to add their maple syrup. I devoured a "chicken" biscuit with orange jalapeño marmalade, kale salad, tofu scramble and sweet potato/white potato home fries.
I  didn't  miss  the  meat, whatsoever. Normally I don't like seitan or tempeh unless I cook with it but they did a great job. Hub's had "chicken" and waffles that were delicious

I was pleasantly surprised with how amazing this food was.  Everything had a lot of flavor to the extent that at one point I forgot I was eating vegan food.  We had several dishes, drumsticks, dumplings, and spinach artichoke dip, they were all better than expected.  I definitely Will be back.
One of the best vegan spots in Atlanta hands down. I love the spicy pad Thai, fettuccine Alfredo, and the spring rolls.

OH MY GAWWDD!!!!  To begin with, I ordered a vanilla latte with soy milk and it was soooo delish! We ordered the Buffalo lollipops, crispy shrimp tacos, sesame soy chicken and the old fashioned chocolate cake - everything was fantastic. It was my friend's first time eating vegan food and he said it tastes better than real meat so there's that. Also, props to our server TAYLOR, she went above and beyond for us. Great service, yummy food and clean place. LOVED IT!!!

I came into Cafe Sunflower Buckhead on Sunday this past weekend with my husband, the restaurant was extremely busy yet the hosts were very polite and were able to communicate with me very well when I would be able to be seated. 
Upon being seated I was able to notice how "fun" the environment was within the restaurant, it was very chic and clean. 
We were thinking the menu was going to have  full menu options but was surprised to see it was only brunch options, our server, Anne, was able to walk us through the menu and discuss what was popular and tasty.  
Me and husband both decided on the chicken and waffles and we were not let down! The seitan chicken was very crispy and authentic to tasting like real chicken. 
Overall me and my husband had a wonderful experience and will definitely be back in the future!

Parking: The lot is somewhat confusing to get into because it looks like you are pulling into the Houston's parking lot, but there is an opening once you turn in so you can park in the plaza where Cafe Sunflower is. 

Ambience: My friend and I sat outside for dinner in 70 degree weather and it was perfect. 

Food (see photos): We ended up ordering the Ginger Spice juice and the Iced Wild Berry Tea- both were wonderful. The Ginger Spice did not have an overbearing ginger taste and the Wild Berry Tea was extremely refreshing. As far as appetizers, we got the Buffalo Lollipops and the Crispy Brussel Sprouts. The Brussel Sprouts were lightly fried and coated in some sort of sweet sauce that was a perfect addition- definitely one of my favorite things on the menu. The Buffalo Lollipops were not my favorite as the texture of them threw me off. They were extremely chewy. As for our entrees, my friend had the special which was the Vegan Crispy Shrimp Tacos and I had the GF Fettucine Alfredo. Both were great and the Alfredo tasted just as good heated up for lunch the next morning. To finish off, we had a slice of the Raspberry Chocolate Cake (super scrumptious and refreshing) paired with a Chai Tea Latte (on the spicier side and GREAT) and a Peppermint Latte (it was okay). 

We overheard the woman at the table behind us talking about the other location in Sandy Springs and how that one is a little different than the Buckhead location. Seeing as how we had a solid time and the food was pretty good, I would want to try out the other location as well.

Living in the south it's almost impossible to find a good vegetarian restaurant. Well that was the case until last week when my friend too me to this place. And glad I am that she did.

By far the best vegetarian restaurant I've been to atlanta. And one would have a preconceived notion that it'll be hippy/bohemian style but to my surprise it was the opposite. Not table cloth fancy but still pretty nice.

The servers were very friendly and attentive.

The menu; so many options that you just can't decide. But needless to say, what ever you order it'll be very good.

As for food, we ordered the Grilled eggplant caprese stack. The eggplant was properly cooked without any soggy feeling and the crispness of the tomatoes worked perfectly well with the eggplant. The best thing about this dish was the cashew cream. It added a hint of sweetness that worked great with the balsamic vinegar.

Next we ordered the roasted portobello mushroom melt. And I'm not over selling it here but you couldn't tell that there wasn't any meat in it. It was just awesome.

Definitely recommend this place for the vegetarian lovers and for the meat lovers looking to be fooled by vegetables acting and tasting like meat.

lovely experience for dinner on a weeknight. I knew I wanted a vegetarian friendly meal so Yelp helped me with the search. Upon entering the restaurant, we were seated in the middle of the dining room. It was neat to see the restaurant has smaller rooms that are created for small group dining. 

For dinner I ordered the burger with fries. The server convinced me that their fresh juices are made to order and delicious. So I asked her if I could get it with alcohol and she responded, of course with champagne. Sold on the drink, I opted for Cucumber Fizz. The drink came out minutes later and it was refreshing. The serving size for the drink with the champagne was unusually large, no complaints. The burger was delicious and filling. The fries were fresh and spot on as well. There was also a salad on the plate, an added healthy bonus. 

Portions here are large so be prepared to take some home or share with someone, or bring a big appetite. 

It's not often you expect to enjoy a vegetarian restaurant that knocks it out of the park but Sunflower knows its vegetarian game. I am coming back for the fresh juices with sparkling wine. 

Parking is easy to find in the lot the restaurant sits in. Don't make the mistake I did and drive past. There are clear signs for cars being towed if you are parked in the incorrect lot.

For a GNO, a friend recommended us this vegetarian friendly place. All of us are not vegetarians, but we wanted to try something different. We didn't make reservations so the host mentioned that the wait was about 30 minutes, but they were able to get us in, in no time.

The girls and I ordered:
-Crispy Brussels Sprouts - it was AMAZING. Not sure if its as healthy since it is fried in tempura batter, but these were good!

-Fried Avocado Tacos -The order comes with 3 tacos, so we were able to share it between the three of us. But it was soooooo good that we had to order another one. One of my friend do not eat cheese, but when she had this taco, she didn't even realized there were cheese in it! This dish is a MUST try!

-Sunflower Burger (We wanted to try the Impossible Burger, since one of my friend was raving about it, but they were out. So the server suggested the sunflower burger & it was okay... it was really dry and we did not like it)

- Fettuccini Alfredo - to be honest, we didn't get to try this at all. We were sitting there talking, and the server just assumed we were done and brought out a to go box before we got to try it. Mind you, we didn't ask for a to go box yet. But it no hard feelings, we were so full from eating the others, so we ended up putting it in the to go box. 

For dessert, we got the Raspberry Chocolate Mousse Cake to share and boy, it was DELICIOUS! I had to order another one to go so my Fiance can try it! Try this, you wont be disappointed. 

Overall the experience was good. If I was to come back, it would probably be for the Tacos and the Raspberry Chocolate Mouse Cake
